info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Ravalli County through 500 PM MDT... At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Hamilton to 7 miles east of Woodside. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Stevensville, Victor, Woodside, Pinesdale, Bell Crossing and Corvallis. This includes Highway 93 S between mile markers 46 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
